article.body: (CNN) Here's a look at the life of Sir John Major, former prime minister of the United Kingdom.      1986 - Is appointed minister of state for social security.      1987-1989 - Serves as chief secretary to the Treasury.      October 1989 - Is appointed Chancellor of the Exchequer.      November 28, 1990 - Becomes prime minister of the United Kingdom.      1990-1997 - Serves as prime minister of the United Kingdom.      June 1995 - Resigns as the head of the Conservative Party and calls for a parliamentary election to establish leadership of the party. He wins the election.      2002 - Admits to having a four-year affair with Edwina Currie, a fellow MP, during the 1980s.      2007 - Major's book, 'More Than A Game: The Story of Cricket's Early Years,' is published.      2012 - Major's book, 'My Old Man: A Personal History of Music Hall,' is published.      February 27, 2017 - During a speech at Chatham House, Major encourages the UK to avoid what he calls a 'hard Brexit' as people in the UK During a speech at Chatham House, Major encourages the UK to avoid what he calls a 'hard Brexit' as people in the UK 'have been led to expect a future that seems to be unreal and over-optimistic.'
article.title: John Major Fast Facts
